subclusters.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
Epigenetic Dysregulation and Partial Reprogramming Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage accumulation triggering senescence and neuroinflammation, linking DNA damage as a causal driver of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on DNA damage response (DDR) signaling cascade activating senescence and SASP, emphasizing DNA damage and repair mechanisms in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights genome instability, chromatin changes, and DNA damage as triggers of senescence and aging, focusing on nuclear genome integrity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes molecular mechanisms of irreversible cell cycle arrest and DNA synthesis suppression in senescent cells, emphasizing DNA damage and cell cycle control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence due to limited proliferative potential and gene expression changes linked to DNA damage and cell cycle arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates telomere attrition, oxidative stress, and genotoxic damage as multifactorial causes of senescence, emphasizing DNA damage-related mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses epigenetic reprogramming and mitochondrial dysfunction reversal but fundamentally links aging to DNA damage and genome integrity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on extracellular HMGB1 redox states propagating senescence via SASP and systemic signaling, highlighting extracellular factors spreading senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP secretion and altered receptor/binding protein signaling in senescent cells affecting tissue environment and promoting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP as a key feature of senescent cells driving aging and therapeutic targeting of senescent cells to modulate SASP effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details the dual role of SASP in aging and tissue regeneration, focusing on secretory phenotype as a driver of aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links SASP secretion by senescent cells to chronic inflammation and age-related intestinal diseases, emphasizing secretory phenotype effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent endothelial cells secreting SASP factors that drive cardiovascular aging and therapeutic targeting via extracellular vesicles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of senescent cells and SASP secretion promoting chronic inflammation and age-related diseases, with senolytics as therapy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Propagation and SASP-Mediated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights SASP secretion by senescent cells in cardiovascular tissues driving inflammation and fibrosis, linking secretory phenotype to disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on therapeutic removal of senescent cells (senolytics/senomorphics) to delay aging and mitigate diseases, emphasizing intervention strategies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CAR T cell therapy targeting senescent cells to improve aging-related decline, highlighting immune-based clearance approaches.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses senescent cell accumulation causing aging and benefits of senolytic drugs in animal models, focusing on therapeutic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents photoactivatable senolysis technology for precise elimination of senescent cells to delay aging, emphasizing targeted senolytic therapy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on immune system role in recognizing and clearing senescent cells, and immune evasion by senescent cells exacerbating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells expressing immune checkpoint ligands causing immune exhaustion and immunosenescence, highlighting immune-senescence interplay.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senolytic and Immune Clearance-Based Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell-derived extracellular vesicles modulating innate immunity and inflammaging, linking senescence to immune dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Dysregulation and Partial Reprogramming Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes epigenome dysregulation in aging and partial reprogramming to reverse senescence and improve health markers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Dysregulation and Partial Reprogramming Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights multifactorial influences on senescence including genetic and physiological factors, and modeling senescence for mechanistic studies.
